intro: Vacciniopsis tetramera, commonly known as the four-merous vacciniopsis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, and it produces dark blue berries that are edible. Vacciniopsis tetramera thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streamside areas.
